Mission

 

The unit is composed of the Security Operations Centre team and several information security experts.

As the Cyber Security Project Manager, you will work closely with multiple stakeholders, most importantly the teams responsible for network security, workplace security and Tech&Ops risk management, as well as with the Group CISO.

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Leading security projects, for example in the fields of vulnerability scanning, security operations automation or threat intelligence.
  • Contributing actively to key IT and business initiatives as an expert in the field; ensuring that information security and cyber risks are adequately covered and that appropriate mitigation or risk-reduction measures are implemented across Tech&Ops.
  • Performing proactive threat intelligence and technology intelligence; when appropriate, providing briefings for stakeholders within the larger information security community at Pictet or issuing memos, including proposed mitigation measures.
  • Organising and leading cyber-incident response exercises; helping to create manuals for dealing with cyber incidents and cyber-crisis contingency plans.
  • Working with the head of Security Operations to align detection and response capabilities to the greater threat landscape; providing expert knowledge in the event of major cyber incidents.
  • Collecting KPIs and KRIs for the Cyber Management Reporting initiative.
  • Maintaining and developing the internal control framework for cyber risk and information security, in close cooperation with the Group Risk functions.
  • Working closely with the Enterprise Architecture team and in particular the Group Security Architect; ensuring that the security architecture is in line with security principles and aligned with the Cyber Security strategy.
Profile

 

  • Higher education in the field of information technology, information systems or computer science (e.g. EPF, university or HES).
  • Proven experience in information security, cyber security or IT risk management.
  • Sound knowledge and in-depth understanding of technologies and concepts used in cyber security; hands-on experience in a field such as network security, application security or pen-testing would be a plus.
  • Knowledge of the main information security standards (NIST, ISO27001 and COBIT) and of financial sector regulations applicable to information security (FINMA, CSSF, MAS and HKMA).
  • Information security (CISMA, CISM, CISSP, etc.) and/or risk management (CRISK, CRM, etc.) certifications would be a plus.
  • Solution oriented, open to change and a self-starter.
  • Able to exert influence, show leadership and be an effective negotiator.
  • Fluent knowledge of French and English (both spoken and written).
  • Main residence in Switzerland mandatory

 

As the successful applicant, your insights will provide important input in defining the cyber-security roadmap. You will not be afraid to strive to achieve ambitious goals and be challenged by knowledgeable experts. Moreover, as a solutions-oriented person with a strong team ethic, you will be looking to embed key cyber security controls and appropriate mitigating measures in the Bank's technology and business initatives.
